articles.author: Alexander Cornwell, Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Israel and Iran launched fresh attacks on each other late on Saturday, stoking fears of a wider conflict after Israel expanded its surprise campaign against its main rival with a strike on the world's biggest gas field.
articles.title: Israel and Iran strike at each other in new wave of attacks

articles.author: John Irish, David Ljunggren
articles.description: Group of Seven leaders gather in the Canadian Rockies starting on Sunday amid growing splits with the United States over foreign policy and trade, with host Canada striving to avoid clashes with President Donald Trump.
articles.title: G7 leaders meet in Canada hoping to avoid Trump clash

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli military spokesperson said the warning included all weapons factories and supporting facilities.
articles.title: Israeli military issues evacuation warnings to Iranians near weapons facilities

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Germany, France and Britain are ready to hold immediate talks with Iran over Tehran's nuclear programme in an effort to de-escalate the situation in the Middle East, German Foreign Minister Johann Wadephul said.
articles.title: Germany, France and UK ready to hold talks with Iran, says German minister

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: It is the fourth in a series of handovers of soldiers' remains to take place in the past week.
articles.title: Russia has handed Ukraine another 1,200 bodies of war dead, Russian news agencies report

articles.author: Abhijith Ganapavaram, Aditya Kalra, Sudipto Ganguly
articles.description: Officials from the U.S. National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) surveyed the site of Air India plane crash that killed at least 271 people, sources said on Sunday, with families continuing to wait for DNA profiling results to identify charred bodies.
articles.title: U.S. officials survey Air India crash site, families continue to wait for bodies

articles.author: Brad Brooks
articles.description: About 50 U.S. Marines squared off against hundreds of protesters in front of a federal building in downtown Los Angeles on Saturday, with the crowd yelling in unison for them to go home.
articles.title: Los Angeles protesters tell US Marines to leave LA

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward, John Kruzel, Jason Lange
articles.description: Americans are divided on major issues that the U.S. Supreme Court is due to rule on in the coming weeks, but most agree on one thing - neither Republicans nor Democrats see the nation's top judicial body as politically neutral, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll.
articles.title: Americans don't see Supreme Court as politically neutral, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Authorities said the gunman was impersonating a police officer and escaped after exchanging fire with police. Gov. Tim Walz called the shootings politically motivated assassination.
articles.title: Minnesota state lawmakers shot, one killed, search underway for suspect, state governor says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Greenland is a European territory and it is normal that Europe and France show their interest, French Foreign Minister Jean Noel Barrot told RTL radio on Sunday when asked about French President Emmanuel Macron's visit to the Arctic island.
articles.title: Greenland is a European territory, says French foreign minister
